title: FPS rate not stable through out game
body:
I recently got a new computer with a gefore gtx 1080 ti and an AMD Ryzen.  However in team fights the FPS will drop from 141 to low 100s or 90s.  However, on games like Overwatch FPS will stay at 150 through out the game.  Both games are set to max graphic settings but in league I have shadows turned off.  Also I update my graphics drivers and that did not help.  I am wondering if this is normal and if it is not normal how do I fix it?

Thank you for any help

replies.body: Grats on your new rig!  Definitely make sure to update your OS to make sure it has necessary products.  Our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide can offer additional steps to tune up your PC.  Since your PC is also[ really good](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209010626-Frame-Skipping-on-High-End-PCs), you may need to try capping your framerate via in-game video options.  Test it out in a custom game, and let me know if it helps.
I don't think you understand... This is a huge problem everyone is having since season 8.. THIS ISNT OUR FAULT {{item:3070}}
Thanks I suspected as much because I have seen several streamers have the same issue.  Kind of annoying to deal with.  I also did not see a reason why Overwatch worked fine but league did not.
